Package silverlib.img

Class Movie

  • java.lang.Object
    • silverlib.img.Movie

  • public class Movie
extends java.lang.Object
    A series of Scenes where the contained Shapes are modified between scenes. Outputs a .mov file
    Since:
    1.7
    Author:
    Jake Trimble

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Movie​(java.lang.String n, int w, int h)
      Initializes a Movie object

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addShape​(java.lang.String n, Shape s)
      Adds a Shape to the Movie display
      void changeShapeColor​(java.lang.String shape, java.awt.Color f)
      Changes the Color of a specified Shape
      void commitChanges​(int dur)
      Adds frames to the Movie for all the changes since the last time commitChanges() was called
      void editShape​(java.lang.String shape, java.lang.String prop, int val)
      Changes a specific property of a specified Shape
      void init​(java.awt.Color c)
      Creates the first Scene in the Movie, sets the initialized field to true, and initializes the curScene and upShapes fields.
      void moveShape​(java.lang.String shape, int chngX, int chngY)
      Moves a specified Shape around the coordinate plane by a certain amount
      void moveShapeTo​(java.lang.String shape, int finX, int finY)

      • Movie

        public Movie​(java.lang.String n,
             int w,
             int h)
        Initializes a Movie object
        Parameters:
        w - The width of all of the Movie's frames
        h - The width of all of the Movie's frames
        Since:
        1.7.3

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init​(java.awt.Color c)
        Creates the first Scene in the Movie, sets the initialized field to true, and initializes the curScene and upShapes fields.
        Parameters:
        c - The background color of the first Scene
        Since:
        1.7.3

      • addShape

        public void addShape​(java.lang.String n,
                     Shape s)
        Adds a Shape to the Movie display
        Parameters:
        n - The name of the Shape, to use when editing it
        s - The Shape
        Since:
        1.7.4

      • moveShape

        public void moveShape​(java.lang.String shape,
                      int chngX,
                      int chngY)
               throws silverlib.img.NoSuchShapeException
        Moves a specified Shape around the coordinate plane by a certain amount
        Parameters:
        shape - The name of the Shape to move
        chngX - The amount to move the Shape by on the x-axis
        chngY - The amount to move the Shape by on the y-axis
        Throws:
        silverlib.img.NoSuchShapeException - If shape is not a valid key
        Since:
        1.7.4

      • moveShapeTo

        public void moveShapeTo​(java.lang.String shape,
                        int finX,
                        int finY)
                 throws silverlib.img.NoSuchShapeException
        Moves a specified Shape to a new loaction
        Parameters:
        shape - The name of the Shape to move
        finX - The x-coordinate to move the Shape to
        finY - The y-coordinate to move the Shape to
        Throws:
        silverlib.img.NoSuchShapeException - If shape is not a valid key
        Since:
        1.7.4

      • changeShapeColor

        public void changeShapeColor​(java.lang.String shape,
                             java.awt.Color f)
                      throws silverlib.img.NoSuchShapeException
        Changes the Color of a specified Shape
        Parameters:
        shape - The name of the Shape to re-color
        f - The Color the shape will be set to
        Throws:
        silverlib.img.NoSuchShapeException - If shape is not a valid key
        Since:
        1.7.4

      • editShape

        public void editShape​(java.lang.String shape,
                      java.lang.String prop,
                      int val)
               throws silverlib.img.NoSuchShapeException,
                      NoSuchPropertyException
        Changes a specific property of a specified Shape
        Parameters:
        shape - The name of the Shape to edit
        prop - The key of the property to modify
        val - The value to set the property to
        Throws:
        silverlib.img.NoSuchShapeException - If shape is not a valid key
        NoSuchPropertyException - If prop is not a valid key
        Since:
        1.7.4

      • commitChanges

        public void commitChanges​(int dur)
                   throws NoSuchPropertyException
        Adds frames to the Movie for all the changes since the last time commitChanges() was called
        Parameters:
        dur - The number of frames in which to commit changes
        Throws:
        NoSuchPropertyException
        Since:
        1.7.4
